info.title: Pick and Pack API
info.description:
The Pick and Pack API provides comprehensive functionality for order management, picking operations, shipment tracking, and returns processing. The main capabilities include:

- Retrieving detailed order information including items, packages, and status

- Accessing worksheet data for picking operations

- Querying shipment tracking and delivery details

- Getting facility information


### General Guidelines

- All timestamps are in ISO 8601 format (`YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss.sssZ`) and `UTC` timezone

- All monetary values are represented in cents

- All requests and responses use JSON format

- Request IDs are included in all responses for tracking purposes


## Authentication Guide

To access the API endpoints, you need to follow these steps to obtain and use a `JWT` token:

1. Configure your `APIKEY_ACCOUNT`, obtain an API key from your account administrator
    
2. Generate `JWT` Token
    
    ``` http
          POST {{ENDPOINT_TOKEN_AUTH}}/token
          Content-Type: application/json
          {
            "apiKey": "your-apikey-account"
          }
    
     ```
    
    Response:
    
    ``` json
          {
            "data": "eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1...[JWT token]"
          }
    
     ```
    
3. Use the `JWT` Token  
    Include the token in the Authorization header for all API requests:
    
    ``` http
          GET {{ENDPOINT_PNP}}/v1/orders/123456
          Authorization: Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1...[JWT token]
    
     ```
    

> Note: The Postman collection includes a pre-request script that automatically handles token generation and renewal. While this script facilitates development, you can disable it and manage authentication manually following the steps above. 
  

## Error Handling

The API uses standard HTTP response codes and returns additional error details in the response body:

``` json
{
  "type": "exception",
  "code": "ORD0002B",
  "message": "Order not found [ORDER-ID]",
  "date": "2024-02-13T15:24:01.933Z",
  "requestId": "2f63bf9c-5730-449a-97b9-4bd36a466ab4"
}

 ```

Common error codes:

- 401 - Authentication
    
- 403 - Forbidden errors (Invalid token, expired token)
    
- 404 - Resource not found
    
- 400 - Invalid request parameters
    
- 500 - Internal server error
    

## Troubleshooting Guide

### Common Issues and Solutions

##### 1\. Token Expiration

- Authentication tokens expire after 15 minutes
    
- Check console logs for refresh attempts
    
- Verify `APIKEY_ACCOUNT` format
    
- Ensure endpoint URLs are correct
    

##### 2\. Variable Errors

- Check variable syntax
    
- Validate API key format
    

##### 3\. Cache-Related Issues

- Response data might appear stale due to API caching
    
- Each endpoint has specific cache duration:
    
    - Orders: 30 seconds
        
    - Shipments: 30 seconds
        
    - Worksheets: 30 seconds
        
    - Facilities: 30 seconds
        
- For real-time data, consider the cache duration when implementing polling strategies
    
- Cache is based on specific parameters (e.g., orderId, shipmentId)
    

### Best Practices

1. Always check response headers for cache information
    
2. Use request IDs for tracking issues
    
3. Monitor API rate limits (30 requests/second, 100 concurrent requests)

example.apiKey: Paste the API key generated from the Pick and Pack admin

example.message: success
success

get.description:
Retrieve order details by ID.

> The response is cached for 30 seconds based on the `orderId` parameter. Rate limited to 30 requests per second with a maximum of 100 concurrent requests.

patch.description: This endpoint helps you complete the Pick and Pack workflow by setting the order status to delivered. You can also update the OMS with additional shipping details. Keep in mind that all fields are optional. For more information, refer to our official documentation here: [https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/orders-api#put-/api/oms/pvt/orders/-orderId-/invoice/-invoiceNumber-/tracking](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/orders-api#put-/api/oms/pvt/orders/-orderId-/invoice/-invoiceNumber-/tracking)

example.message: The order must be invoiced to update the status to delivered
The order must be invoiced to update the status to delivered

get.description:
Retrieves detailed information about a shipment using either the internal system ID or the carrier's tracking ID.

### Path Variables

- `shipmentId` (required): Can be either:
    
    - Internal UUID (when using BY_INTERNAL_ID filter)
        
    - Carrier tracking number (when using BY_EXTERNAL_ID filter)
        

### Headers

- `X-PNP-FilterMethod` (required): Determines how the shipmentId will be interpreted
    
    - `BY_INTERNAL_ID`: Use internal system UUID
        
    - `BY_EXTERNAL_ID`: Use carrier tracking number
        

> The response is cached for 30 seconds based on both the `shipmentId` parameter and `X-PNP-FilterMethod` header. Rate limited to 30 requests per second with a maximum of 100 concurrent requests.

example.message: You do not have access to this shipment [da6c9988-7659-4cbd-bee3-5b44309eae07]
You do not have access to this shipment [da6c9988-7659-4cbd-bee3-5b44309eae07]

get.description:
List all shipments by order ID.

> The response is cached for 30 seconds based on the `orderId` query parameter. Rate limited to 30 requests per second with a maximum of 100 concurrent requests.

Query string parameter {orderId} is required

Content-Type.name: Content-Type
Content-Type.description: Type of the content being sent.

Accept.name: Accept
Accept.description: HTTP Client Negotiation _Accept_ Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.

Authorization.name: Authorization
Authorization.description: Authentication JWT. JSON Web Token (JWT) is an open standard (RFC 7519) that defines a compact and self-contained way for securely transmitting information as a JSON object between parties.
